info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 3 at 4:06AM CDT until August 3 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Huntsville AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Alabama, including the following county, DeKalb.
* WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to recent thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Payne, Rainsville, Crossville, Pine Ridge, Collbran, Lebanon, Dog Town, Adamsburg, Peeks Corner, Guest, Little River Canyon NP, Desoto State Park and Skirum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
